content:
0.67 g of Zn­(NO3)2·6H2O and 1.33 g of 2-MeIM were dissolved in 15 g of DMSO, and the mixture was kept still at room temperature for 24 h. The formed powder was washed by MeOH several times, centrifuged, and vacuum-dried. All these procedures were performed at room temperature.

Fabrication of ZIF-8/PU Composites

Taking the preparation of the ZIF-8/PU(2) composite as an example, waterborne PU was synthesized according to the literature (more details in the Supporting Information and Figure S1). PU was vacuum-dried at 30 °C for 24 h prior to use. 1 g of PU was dissolved in 7.5 g of DMSO. ZIF-8 precursors, that is, 0.67 g of Zn­(NO3)2·6H2O and 1.33 g of 2-MeIM, were dissolved in 7.5 g of DMSO. The two solutions were mixed together and intensely stirred for 12 h, during which some particles that might contain ZIF-8 were formed (Figure S2). The mixture was then frozen under −25 °C overnight. After that, the completely frozen mixture was immersed in iced water to leach out DMSO. Iced water was used to prevent DMSO crystals from melting during their removal so that they could be used as templates. Finally, the ZIF-8/PU composite was obtained after vacuum-drying at room temperature for 48 h.
clean_text:
Preparation of ZIF-8 Powder

0.67 g of Zn(NO3)2⋅6H2O and 1.33 g of 2-MeIM were dissolved in 15 g of DMSO, and the mixture was kept still at room temperature for 24 h. The formed powder was washed by MeOH several times, centrifuged, and vacuum-dried. All these procedures were performed at room temperature.

Fabrication of ZIF-8/PU Composites

Taking the preparation of the ZIF-8/PU(2) composite as an example, waterborne PU was synthesized according to the literature (more details in the Supporting Information and Figure S1). PU was vacuum-dried at 30 °C for 24 h prior to use. 1 g of PU was dissolved in 7.5 g of DMSO. ZIF-8 precursors, that is, 0.67 g of Zn(NO3)2⋅6H2O and 1.33 g of 2-MeIM, were dissolved in 7.5 g of DMSO. The two solutions were mixed together and intensely stirred for 12 h, during which some particles that might contain ZIF-8 were formed (Figure S2). The mixture was then frozen under -25 °C overnight. After that, the completely frozen mixture was immersed in iced water to leach out DMSO. Iced water was used to prevent DMSO crystals from melting during their removal so that they could be used as templates. Finally, the ZIF-8/PU composite was obtained after vacuum-drying at room temperature for 48 h.
